DataElement.preferredName: Tumor Mass Cervical Neoplasm Histologic Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The type of tissue in which a malignant neoplasm involving the cervix originated.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Concepts.definition: A benign or malignant pathologic structure in any part of the body, resulting from a neoplastic accumulation of cells.

Property.preferredDefinition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

Concepts.definition: Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

DataElementConcept.origin: CPTAC: Clinical Proteomic Tumor Analysis Consortium
DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 2/14/20 jk Upd RD to "Qualified"; CPTAC released AI. 1/2/20 jk Released per CPTAC SME (Linda) for PRAD Baseline CRF. 7/26/19 jk Updated OC term to Tumor Mass; used on multiple CPTAC CRFs.  6/26/19 jk created for CPTAC Baseline CRFs.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A benign or malignant neoplasm that affects the cervix. Representative examples include endocervical polyp, rhabdomyoma, carcinoma, and melanoma._Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An uncommon carcinoma arising from the cervix.  It is composed of malignant glandular epithelial cells and malignant squamous epithelial cells.

Concepts.definition: An uncommon carcinoma arising from the cervix.  It is composed of malignant glandular epithelial cells and malignant squamous epithelial cells.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the cervical epithelium. It accounts for approximately 15% of invasive cervical carcinomas. Increased numbers of sexual partners and human papillomavirus (HPV) infection are risk factors. Grossly, advanced cervical adenocarcinoma may present as an exophytic mass, an ulcerated lesion, or diffuse cervical enlargement. Microscopically, the majority of cervical adenocarcinomas are of the endocervical (mucinous) type.

Concepts.definition: An adenocarcinoma arising from the endocervical glandular epithelium. It is classified as either human papillomavirus-related or human papillomavirus-independent adenocarcinoma. Histologic variants include usual-type, mucinous, mesonephric, serous, clear cell, and endometrioid adenocarcinoma.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant of cervical squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of polygonal squamous cells. Intercellular bridges and cytoplasmic keratinization may be present, but keratin pearls are absent.

Concepts.definition: A variant of cervical squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of polygonal squamous cells. Intercellular bridges and cytoplasmic keratinization may be present, but keratin pearls are absent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A variant of cervical squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of keratin pearls. Intercellular bridges and cytoplasmic keratinization are usually present.

Concepts.definition: A variant of cervical squamous cell carcinoma characterized by the presence of keratin pearls. Intercellular bridges and cytoplasmic keratinization are usually present.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A selected option that indicated an other histologic type.

Concepts.definition: A selected option that indicated an other histologic type.

ValueMeaning.changeDescription: Concept annotation added for UPitt/TCGA.  Ylu, 02/03/2015.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Specification of human conditions relevant to cancer. This includes observations, test results, history, and other concepts relevant to characterization of human cancer-related conditions. Non-neoplastic conditions of interest are also included.

Concepts.definition: A benign, malignant, or precancerous neoplasm that affects the cervix.
Refers to the type of tissue in which a tumor originated.
Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
